ratings.comment: I am irate that this moron is even considered a teacherinstructor. Worst teacher I've ever had. Instead of wasting my life I skipped every class aftwr the third one to teach myself the material and got an A.  Don't EVER take a class with him.

His lectures are pretty much pointless, I only went so I didn't feel like I was wasting my parents money. He makes SEVERAL mistakes every lecture and is constantly being corrected my students. Hard to understand and likes to stand in front of what he is writing so you can't even see it. Wouldn't take a class with him again.
Way  too confusing. No real personality, and I had to rely on my TA to actually teach me.

Between his endless tries to make stupid jokes that only he finds funny & constant mistakes where you are always erasing, you are better off trying to teach yourself the material. Also if you are in lecture and have a question, I hope you are in the first 3 rows, because thats all that he calls on. Don't take him unless you have to.

Provides little to no information about the subject before he teaches it,  but instead jumps right in and fails to go back and elaborate. Usually makes about four or five mistakes per lesson; it's okay though, because a student is usually there to correct him. Constantly stands RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE CHALK BOARD! Would rather read out of the book.

Pretty sad excuse for a teacher. I don't think I got anything out of lecture. He makes a lot of mistakes, which end up being confusing while he's fixing and trying to teach. He gives little partial credit on anything. I went to his office hour to ask him about an exam question and he wouldn't explain what I did wrong. Learn on your own.

Extremely mediocre professor. Just does problems from the textbook during lecture and does them confusingly and messes up a lot. However, the exams are predictable and the material isn't horrible. So it's not the end of the world if you get him. Just prepared to do all of the work on your own. P.S. He gives out like no partial credit on exams.

Pretty decent professor. The material is such that a lot of learning will happen while doing the homework. His tests were a fair representation of the homework. Put in the effort and you should do well is his class.

Simply put, very unavailable. Emailed him several times when I missed class, received responses likeable to "Covered material from Section 4.1. Will not respond to another email like this." Ended up having a horrible grade despite a raw score of 78%. Pass on him if you can, otherwise prepare for unavailability and lack of help from him.
His midterm was incredibly easy, but his final was impossible. You get credit for turning in the homework and the quizzes are very easy.

Great professor for entry-level calculus. Very helpful and seems to really care about his students. Feel free to ask questions during exams and drop by to see him in his office anytime. He also does review basic algebra during problems, not assuming that everybody can follow at the same pace. He does make some mistakes but laughs about it.

This guy, and his TA's both suck. His lectures are all over the place, all he does is show what you need to do, he doesn't show you how to do it, that's up to the TA or yourself. The TA I had was useless, we only met 5 or 6 times, he never held office hours, and changed our room 'just for fun' in the middle of the semester. Don't take this class.

class is very hard if youre not good at math...can't use calculators and the lectures are kinda all over the place. Exams are hard and overall this class just sucked, but hey im not math major so that might have played a part.

I'm not sure why everyone complains about Camacho. Even though he does make a lot of mistakes during lecture, he's definitely willing to help anyone... you just need to make the effort. I attended all lectures and ended up with an A.

Wasn't too hard of a class, but his lectures are a little painful. He makes tons of mistakes, basically just copies examples from the textbook, and he can be hard to understand because of his accent. I probably skipped about half of the lectures and still got an B in the class, because you really can teach everything that he goes over to yourself.

There is a lot of homework and depending on your T/A it will get graded on accuracy. Three Midterms and a Final, not a easy math class. I personally liked Camacho, but hated his class. There really is no point in going to lecture because he just copies examples out of the book onto an overhead. Pointless.

I attended the first eight lectures and then not a single one. His accent, combined with his inability to teach made the class frustrating. He stood at the front of the lecture and copied the textbook down onto an overhead. Overall, awful experience with him.

For CEE 340 I liked that he did lots of examples, but he would just turn around and start doing calcs without explaining what method he was doing. At times his lectures can be hard to follow. for exams you get to use all your notes and you book.
Good easy class. Nice Guy. Easy Tests. Not really sure I learned as much as I could have with someone else, but I'll take the A and run.

Examples presented in class are not directly relevant to the material - goes off on tangents a lot. Homework and exams are DECEIVINGLY easy. By taking this class you are GAMBLING with your GPA. You won't know the material well and your grade will be dependent on luck. I knew the material and got close to 100 on the 2 midterms but failed the final.

Makes mistakes during lecture, it's ok, it helps you learn. (does it on purpose??) Has an engineering background, so will work with you if in Engineering. He is a nice man also, quirky sense of humor. Tests are very fair, and homework is quite light. Would probably recommend this professor. Certainly better than most Math dept profs.

Worst teacher I have ever had. SWITCH IF POSSIBLE, make so many mistakes it is impossible to follow, has an annoying weird spanish accent and doesn't know how to teach math.  Exams are not made by him so he has no idea what is on the exam and tells you all the wrong stuff to study.
Good teacher. Funny. Does make a lot of mistakes, but somehow it's helpful....if you can catch his mistakes, it means you understand what's going on.
He's nice, funny, and easy to follow along with in class. He does a lot of helpful examples in class and shows the steps to problems quite clearly. Weekly quizzes are very easy.
No Comments
He is very nice and laid back but he makes a lot of mistakes while teaching and doesn't realize it until we say something.
I woul have rather taken the class from his graduate student because he is not very clear.

pretty good teacher, examples and explanations are really clear. makes some mistakes, but are easy to catch. pretty funny.The tests are killer, though, so make sure you study and stay on top of the homework. As long as you do the work , the weekly quizzes are pretty easy.
No Comments

I thought he did a really good job of giving example problems that apply to all of the problems that you need to know.  If you take notes of the problems he does on the board and understand them, the weekly quiz are pretty easy.  I wish that I could have him teach all of my math classes!

He's a good teacher.A lil hard to understand bc he has a slight accent, but he is pretty funny.As long as you study you'll do great on the weekly quizzes.The exams really suck, but study and you'll be fine.Don't take the 7:45 because it's boring that early!
